skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.

security_audit.summary: Official source skill with predefined guidance and no executable code. Minimal audit performed and no security issues identified.

content.value_statement: Writing structured documents often stalls because context and structure are unclear. This skill guides you through context gathering, drafting, and reader testing.
actual_capabilities: Collects document type, audience, impact, and constraints through structured questions
Guides context dumping and generates targeted clarifying questions
Proposes document sections and creates a placeholder scaffold
Iterates section drafting with brainstorming, curation, and edits
Runs reader testing using sub-agents or manual instructions
limitations: Needs user provided context to draft accurate content
Cannot access external documents without enabled integrations
Does not verify factual accuracy or external links
Reader testing requires sub-agent support or manual steps

use_cases.title: Draft a PRD
use_cases.description: Guide a structured PRD draft with audience goals, scope, and decisions clarified early.

use_cases.title: Write a technical spec
use_cases.description: Build a spec section by section with clear tradeoffs and implementation details.

use_cases.title: Create a decision doc
use_cases.description: Capture the decision, alternatives, and rationale with reader testing checks.

prompt_templates.title: Start a doc
prompt_templates.scenario: You need help drafting a new document
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to write a decision doc about migrating our API gateway. Use your workflow and start with context gathering.

prompt_templates.title: Use my template
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a required document template
prompt_templates.prompt: I need a technical spec and must follow our template. Ask your initial questions and then help me fill each section.

prompt_templates.title: Refine sections
prompt_templates.scenario: You want iterative edits on a section
prompt_templates.prompt: Focus on the technical approach section. Ask questions, brainstorm options, and then draft it for review.

prompt_templates.title: Reader test it
prompt_templates.scenario: You want to validate the document
prompt_templates.prompt: We have a full draft. Run reader testing and list the gaps you find, then suggest fixes.

output_examples.input: Create a proposal doc for a new onboarding flow and guide me through the workflow.
output: Asks for document type, audience, impact, and constraints
Requests an info dump of current onboarding pain points
Proposes sections like Goals, Scope, Approach, Risks
Drafts the first section and asks for specific edits

best_practices: Provide context in one dump before answering clarifying questions
Review each section and give precise edit requests
Run reader testing and fix gaps before sharing the document
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and jumping to full drafting
Editing the document directly without giving feedback
Ignoring reader testing results and shipping as is

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, or Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is a text based workflow and works across these platforms.

faq.question: What are the limits of the workflow?
faq.answer: It depends on the detail you provide and the document size you want.

faq.question: Can it pull content from Google Drive or Slack?
faq.answer: Only if the platform connectors or integrations are enabled.

faq.question: Is my data stored or shared?
faq.answer: The skill itself does not store data beyond the session context.

faq.question: What if the draft feels generic or off?
faq.answer: Provide specific edits and missing context, then iterate the section.

faq.question: How does it compare to freeform writing?
faq.answer: It adds structure, questions, and testing to reduce blind spots.
